column5: psd: Fix crash on broken files
column6: commit 343954ca98bac316b28fd6af0262ced89aa5f05cAuthor: Albert Astals Cid <aacid@kde.org>Date:   Wed Apr 13 23:06:15 2022 +0200    psd: Fix crash on broken files        Instead of resizing the bytearray to the potential size and then reading    into it, ask the device to read into a bytearray, this way instead of a    crash because we're trying to resize to a too big number we get a nice      maxSize argument exceeds QByteArray size limit    warning        oss-fuzz/46664

column5: xcf: Fix Stack-buffer-overflow WRITE on broken files
column6: commit 297ed9a2fe339bfe36916b9fce628c3242e5be0fAuthor: Albert Astals Cid <aacid@kde.org>Date:   Fri Apr 30 00:07:21 2021 +0200    xcf: Fix Stack-buffer-overflow WRITE on broken files        oss-fuzz/33742
commit 8ad43638ad55cf9bfc12af35aa3c33bd255dd375Author: Albert Astals Cid <aacid@kde.org>Date:   Tue Jan 5 20:48:29 2021 +0100    Fix crash with malformed files        oss-fuzz/29284

commit f03739f222139fc6602f5c6139b045fa9ec73902Author: Albert Astals Cid <aacid@kde.org>Date:   Sat Dec 14 21:04:46 2019 +0100    pic: Fix Invalid-enum-value undefined behaviour        Summary:    Instead of directly casting the quint8 to PicChannelEncoding we just store the quint8    and compare it to the possible PicChannelEncoding values when needed        oss-fuzz/19344        Reviewers: dfaure        Reviewed By: dfaure        Subscribers: dfaure, security-team, kde-frameworks-devel        Tags: #frameworks        Differential Revision: https://phabricator.kde.org/D25937

commit 4bf2894bdee81ae7da6953f05915351685373b75Author: Albert Astals Cid <aacid@kde.org>Date:   Thu Sep 5 20:05:29 2019 +0200    Fix uninitialized memory read        Summary:    Make sure whole of pixel_size in pixel has data either because it was    read or because we set it to 0        oss-fuzz/14565        Reviewers: dfaure, apol, vkrause        Reviewed By: vkrause        Subscribers: kde-frameworks-devel        Tags: #frameworks        Differential Revision: https://phabricator.kde.org/D23739

column5: ras: fix crash on broken files
column6: commit 20100a1e0ef1c10d07b2eb8c10e5b52e01a364c7Author: Albert Astals Cid <aacid@kde.org>Date:   Fri Mar 1 23:32:33 2019 +0100    ras: fix crash on broken files        Replace QVector::operator[] with QVector::value() since we can't know for    sure the values will be on range so use value() that gives us a 0 if the    index is not on range        oss-fuzz/13462
